alert.note: Alert for Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 10:55PM CDT until May 13 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Brown, Coleman, Runnels and San Saba. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms across Coleman and Brown counties, moving slowly north. Additional storms were moving north into southern Saba county near Cherokee. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownwood, Coleman, San Saba, Early, Santa Anna, Richland Springs, Algerita, Cherokee, Bangs, Blanket, Novice, Brookesmith, Winchell, Trickham, Elm Grove, Camp Bowie, Lake Brownwood, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Rockwood and Skeeterville. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Indian Creek at 9th, Austin Street at Avenue G, Good Shephard at 11th, Gifford at Beaver, Magnolia at Belmeade, Willis at Belmeade, Belle Plain at Romines, Cordell at Anderson, 4th Street at Wood and Austin Street at Avenue J. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
